title: Belgium to Recognize Palestinian State, Joining Pressure on Israel
description: The recognition was conditioned on the release of hostages by Hamas. It comes after similar moves by other countries as they try to push Israel to end the war in Gaza.
content:
Belgium will recognize a Palestinian state at this month’s United Nations General Assembly, the country’s foreign minister announced early on Tuesday, joining a number of other states in a push intended to pressure Israel over its war on Gaza.

Palestine will be “clearly a state fully recognized on the international stage by Belgium,” the foreign minister, Maxime Prévot, said on social media, though that recognition would take full effect only if key conditions were met.

The “formalization” of the move will take place “once the last hostage has been released and Hamas no longer has any role in managing Palestine,” Mr. Prévot said. It would come by royal decree, he added.

European leaders have been frustrated that Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s prime minister, has not ended the war, which has destroyed large parts of Gaza. More than 60,000 Palestinians have been killed, including about 18,000 children and minors, according to Palestinian health officials, whose tallies do not distinguish between civilians and combatants. The territory is gripped by a humanitarian crisis, with food-security experts saying that large parts of Gaza are suffering from famine. Israel rejects that designation.
summary: Belgian Foreign Minister, Maxime Prévot, has announced that Belgium will officially recognize the Palestinian state at the United Nations General Assembly, joining other countries in a push to pressure Israel over its war on Gaza. The recognition would only take effect if key conditions were met. The announcement comes by royal decree. The conflict has resulted in over 60,000 deaths and a humanitarian crisis in Gaza.
shortSummary: Belgian officials announced plans to recognize the Palestinian state at the UN's helm, amid ongoing pressure from Israel over its treatment of Palestinians.
argos_summary: Belgium announced it will formally recognize a Palestinian state at the upcoming United Nations General Assembly, a move contingent on the release of hostages and the removal of Hamas from governance. The recognition is part of a broader international effort to pressure Israel to end its war in Gaza. Belgium’s foreign minister Maxime Prévot stated the formalization would occur by royal decree once conditions are met.
